forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 43. West wind around 17 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 55. West wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 41 mph.

weather_report:
As the first light of dawn approaches, Boston finds itself draped in a quiet still, the air crisp and inviting for those willing to embrace the coolness of a November morning. With temperatures dipping to a cool 43 degrees overnight, the sensation is refreshing rather than biting, with a spirited west wind rustling through the streets at a brisk pace. As you step outside, you may feel the swift caress of gusts that dance around you, urging you to layer up wisely; a warm coat, perhaps a cozy scarf, will suffice to keep you invigorated. 

As the sun emerges, you can expect a bright and cheerful day with clear skies and temperatures climbing to a mild 55 degrees. The sun will cast its warmth across the city, but the wind—stronger than it appears—will remind us of winter’s approach. Outfits should lean toward comfort as you embark on your day; think of soft, breathable fabrics with a sturdy jacket to shield against any unwelcome chills. Given the pleasant yet brisk nature of the day, it’s a splendid opportunity for leisurely walks along the Charles River, where the water glistens under the sun, or a quiet stop at a local café nestled in the heart of the city, perfect for warming your hands around a cup of coffee while watching the world meander by.
